channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Movie Posters from Africa That Are So Bad, They're Good
item.description:
Welcome to the world of Ghanaian movie posters. They’re often hilarious. Why They Matter TodayThese posters are more than just curiosities.

Read more

item.title: Alzheimer's disrupts circadian rhythms of plaque-clearing brain cells
item.description:
Louis have now shown in mice that the circadian rhythms within particular brain cells are disrupted in Alzheimer’s disease in ways that change how and when hundreds of genes regulate key functions in the brain. “There are 82 genes that have been associated with Alzheimer’s disease risk, and we found that the circadian rhythm is controlling the activity of about half of those,” said Erik S. In addition, the researchers found that the presence of amyloid appeared to create new rhythms in hundreds of genes that do not typically have a circadian pattern of activity.

Read more

item.title: Show HN: FlashRecord – 2MB Python-native CLI screen recorder
item.description:
Features Native Screenshot - Instant screen capture with Pillow/PIL (no external tools needed) Screen Recording to GIF - One-command full screen recording with imageio + numpy Intelligent Compression - 99. 0s Example 3: Python Script Integration from flashrecord. screenshot import take_screenshot from flashrecord.

Read more

item.title: Making the Electron Microscope
item.description:
The Long ReadMaking the Electron MicroscopeIn a little over a century, the electron microscope evolved from a tool barely capable of resolving virus particles into one able to capture atomic detail. But over the next century, refinements in design, sample preparation, and computation transformed the electron microscope into an indispensable tool for modern biology. SourceEven as electron microscopes have allowed us to view ever smaller structures with clarity, challenges remain.

Read more

item.title: Myanmar military shuts down a major cybercrime center, detains over 2k people
item.description:
19, 2025, soldiers stand next to Starlink machines as they seize KK Park online scam center in Myawaddy township, Karen State, Myanmar. (The Myanmar Military True News Information Team via AP) Read More 2 of 2 | In this image provided by the Myanmar military on Oct. 19, 2025, soldiers raid the KK Park online scam center in Myawaddy township, Karen State, Myanmar.
